awd_titl_txt: An Experimental Study of the Structure of an Impinging      Coaxial Jet: Research Initiation Award
awd_abstract_narration: A jet impinging on a rigid surface will be studied with the aim of              alleviating resonance effects which can occur in this situation.  Both          subsonic and supersonic conditions will be investigated                         experimentally.  The focus is to be on co-axial circular jets, in the           belief that this configuration is highly likely to provide reduction            in adverse pressure fluctuations.  Such reductions have been observed           in free co-axial jets, and their ground impingement has not been                previously explored.                                                                                                                                            Application is to VSTOL aircraft, particularly to supersonic                    operation.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
